maml:description.maml:para: Gets account information for a given ID
The Get-RocketCyberAccount cmdlet gets account information all accounts or for a given ID from the RocketCyber API
The account ID to pull data for
If not provided, data will be pulled for all accounts accessible by the key
Should additional Details for each sub-accounts be displayed in the return data
The account ID to pull data for
If not provided, data will be pulled for all accounts accessible by the key
Should additional Details for each sub-accounts be displayed in the return data

dev:remarks.maml:para: Account data will be retrieved from all accounts accessible by the key
Account data will be retrieved for the account with the AccountId 12345
Account data will be retrieved for the account with the AccountId 12345

maml:description.maml:para: Gets RocketCyber agents from an account
The Get-RocketCyberAgent cmdlet gets all the device information for all devices associated to the account ID provided.
The account id associated to the device
If not provided, data will be pulled for all accounts accessible by the key
Multiple comma separated values can be inputted
The agent id
Multiple comma separated values can be inputted
The device hostname
Multiple comma separated values can be inputted
The IP address tied to the device
Multiple comma separated values can be inputted
The date range for when agents were created
Both the start and end dates are optional, but at least one is required to use this parameter
Cannot be used with the StartDate & EndDate parameters
Start UTC Time | End UTC Time
The OS used by the device
As of 2023-03 using * do not appear to work correctly
Example: Windows* Windows
The agent version
As of 2023-03 this filter appears not to work correctly
Example: Server 2019
The connectivity status of the agent
Multiple comma separated values can be inputted
Allowed values: 'online', 'offline', 'isolated'
The target page of data
This is used with pageSize parameter to determine how many and which items to return
The number of items to return from the data set
The sort order for the items queried
Not all values can be sorted
Example: hostname:asc AccountId:desc
Returns all items from an endpoint
The account id associated to the device
If not provided, data will be pulled for all accounts accessible by the key
Multiple comma separated values can be inputted
The agent id
Multiple comma separated values can be inputted
The device hostname

The IP address tied to the device

Both the start and end dates are optional, but at least one is required to use this parameter

maml:description.maml:para: Gets an accounts apps from the RocketCyber API
The Get-RocketCyberApp cmdlet gets an accounts apps from the RocketCyber API
Can be used with the Get-RocketCyberEvent cmdlet
The account ID to pull data for
If not provided, data will be pulled for all accounts accessible by the key
The type of apps to request
Acceptable values are: 'active', 'inactive'
The default value is 'active'
The account ID to pull data for
If not provided, data will be pulled for all accounts accessible by the key
The type of apps to request
Acceptable values are: 'active', 'inactive'
The default value is 'active'

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets active apps from accounts accessible by the key
Gets active apps from account 12345
Gets inactive apps from account 12345

maml:description.maml:para: Gets defender information from the RocketCyber API
The Get-RocketCyberDefender cmdlet gets an accounts defender information from the RocketCyber API
This includes various health & risk values
The account ID to pull data for
If not provided, data will be pulled for all accounts accessible by the key
The account ID to pull data for
If not provided, data will be pulled for all accounts accessible by the key

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets defender information all accounts accessible by the key
Gets defender information from account 12345

maml:description.maml:para: Gets app event information from the RocketCyber API
The Get-RocketCyberEvent cmdlet gets app event information for events associated to all or a defined account ID
Use the Get-RockerCyberApp cmdlet to get app ids
The app ID
The verdict of the event
Multiple comma separated values can be inputted
Allowed Values: 'informational', 'suspicious', 'malicious'
The account id associated to the device
If not provided, data will be pulled for all accounts accessible by the key
Multiple comma separated values can be inputted
This parameter allows users to target specific attributes within the Details object
This requires you to define the attribute path (period separated) and the expected value
The value can include wildcards (*)
Example: (AppId 7) attributes.direction:outbound
The date range for event detections
Both the start and end dates are optional, but at least one is required to use this parameter
Start Time | End Time
The target page of data
This is used with pageSize parameter to determine how many and which items to return
The number of items to return from the data set
The sort order for the items queried
Not all values can be sorted
Example: verdict:asc dates:desc
Returns all items from an endpoint
The account id associated to the device
If not provided, data will be pulled for all accounts accessible by the key
Multiple comma separated values can be inputted
Shows summary of events for each app
The app ID
The verdict of the event
Multiple comma separated values can be inputted
Allowed Values: 'informational', 'suspicious', 'malicious'
The account id associated to the device
If not provided, data will be pulled for all accounts accessible by the key
Multiple comma separated values can be inputted
Shows summary of events for each app

This requires you to define the attribute path (period separated) and the expected value
The value can include wildcards (*)

Both the start and end dates are optional, but at least one is required to use this parameter

This is used with pageSize parameter to determine how many and which items to return
The number of items to return from the data set
The sort order for the items queried
Not all values can be sorted
Example: verdict:asc dates:desc
Returns all items from an endpoint

maml:description.maml:para: Gets incident information from the RocketCyber API
The Get-RocketCyberIncident cmdlet gets incident information associated to all or a defined account ID
The RocketCyber incident ID
Multiple comma separated values can be inputted
The number of items to return from the data set
The sort order for the items queried
Not all values can be sorted
Example: AccountId:asc title:desc
The title of the incident
Example: Office*
Multiple comma separated values can be inputted
The account id associated to the device
If not provided, data will be pulled for all accounts accessible by the key
Multiple comma separated values can be inputted
The description of the incident
NOTE: Wildcards are required to search for specific text
Example: administrative
The remediation for the incident
NOTE: Wildcards are required to search for specific text
Example: permission*

This returns incidents resolved between the start and end date
Both the start and end dates are optional, but at least one is required to use this parameter

This returns incidents created between the start and end date

Allowed Values: 'open', 'resolved'

This is used with pageSize parameter to determine how many and which items to return

maml:alert.maml:para: As of 2023-03: Any parameters that say wildcards are required is not valid
Using wildcards in the query string do not work as the endpoint already search's via wildcard. If you use a wildcard '*' it will not return any results
The remediation parameter does not appear to work

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets the first 1000 incidents from all accounts accessible by the key
Gets the defined incident Id from the defined AccountId
Gets the first 1000 incidents from all accounts accessible by the key that were resolved after the defined startDate with the defined word in the title
Gets the first 1000 incidents from all accounts accessible by the key that were created before the defined endDate with the defined word in the description
Gets the first 1000 resolved incidents from all accounts accessible by the key and the data is return by title in ascending order

maml:description.maml:para: Sets your API key used to authenticate all API calls
The Add-RocketCyberAPIKey cmdlet sets your API key which is used to authenticate all API calls made to RocketCyber. Once the API key is defined, it is encrypted using SecureString
The RocketCyber API keys are generated via the RocketCyber web interface at Provider Settings > RocketCyber API
Plain text API key
If not defined the cmdlet will prompt you to enter the API key which will be stored as a SecureString
Input a SecureString object containing the API key
Plain text API key
If not defined the cmdlet will prompt you to enter the API key which will be stored as a SecureString
Input a SecureString object containing the API key

dev:remarks.maml:para: Prompts to enter in the API key
The RocketCyber API will use the string entered into the [ -ApiKey ] parameter
The Add-RocketCyberAPIKey function will use the string passed into it as its API key

maml:description.maml:para: Sets the base URI for the RocketCyber API connection
The Add-RocketCyberBaseUri cmdlet sets the base URI which is later used to construct the full URI for all API calls
Define the base URI for the RocketCyber API connection using RocketCyber's URI or a custom URI
RocketCyber's URI connection point that can be one of the predefined data centers
The accepted values for this parameter are: [ US, EU ] US = https://api-us.rocketcyber.com/v3 EU = https://api-eu.rocketcyber.com/v3
Define the base URI for the RocketCyber API connection using RocketCyber's URI or a custom URI
RocketCyber's URI connection point that can be one of the predefined data centers
The accepted values for this parameter are: [ US, EU ] US = https://api-us.rocketcyber.com/v3 EU = https://api-eu.rocketcyber.com/v3

dev:remarks.maml:para: The base URI will use https://api-us.rocketcyber.com/v3 which is RocketCyber's default URI
The base URI will use https://api-eu.rocketcyber.com/v3 which is RocketCyber's Europe URI
A custom API gateway of http://myapi.gateway.celerium.org will be used for all API calls to RocketCyber's API

maml:description.maml:para: Converts uri filter parameters
The Invoke-RocketCyberRequest cmdlet converts & formats uri filter parameters from a function which are later used to make the full resource uri for an API call
This is an internal helper function the ties in directly with the Invoke-RocketCyberRequest & any public functions that define parameters
Hashtable of values to combine a functions parameters with the ResourceUri parameter
This allows for the full uri query to occur
Defines the short resource uri (url) to use when creating the API call
Hashtable of values to combine a functions parameters with the ResourceUri parameter
This allows for the full uri query to occur
Defines the short resource uri (url) to use when creating the API call

dev:remarks.maml:para: Example: (From public function) $UriFilter = @{}
ForEach ( $Key in $PSBoundParameters.GetEnumerator() ) { if( $excludedParameters -contains $Key.Key ) {$null} else{ $UriFilter += @{ $Key.Key = $Key.Value } } }
1x key = https://api-us.rocketcyber.com/v3/account?AccountId=12345 2x key = https://api-us.rocketcyber.com/v3/account?AccountId=12345&details=True

maml:description.maml:para: Exports the RocketCyber BaseUri, API, & JSON configuration information to file
The Export-RocketCyberModuleSettings cmdlet exports the RocketCyber BaseUri, API, & JSON configuration information to file

Making use of PowerShell's System.Security.SecureString type, exporting module settings encrypts your API key in a format that can only be unencrypted with the your Windows account as this encryption is tied to your user principal This means that you cannot copy your configuration file to another computer or user account and expect it to work
Define the location to store the RocketCyber configuration file
By default the configuration file is stored in the following location: $env:USERPROFILE\Celerium.RocketCyber
Define the name of the RocketCyber configuration file
By default the configuration file is named: config.psd1
Define the location to store the RocketCyber configuration file
By default the configuration file is stored in the following location: $env:USERPROFILE\Celerium.RocketCyber
Define the name of the RocketCyber configuration file
By default the configuration file is named: config.psd1

dev:remarks.maml:para: Validates that the BaseUri, API, and JSON depth are set then exports their values to the current user's RocketCyber configuration file located at: $env:USERPROFILE\Celerium.RocketCyber\config.psd1
Validates that the BaseUri, API, and JSON depth are set then exports their values to the current user's RocketCyber configuration file located at: C:\Celerium.RocketCyber\MyConfig.psd1

maml:description.maml:para: Gets the RocketCyber API key
The Get-RocketCyberAPIKey cmdlet gets the RocketCyber API key global variable and returns it as a SecureString
Decrypt and return the API key in plain text
Decrypt and return the API key in plain text

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets the RocketCyber API key and returns it as a SecureString
Gets and decrypts the API key from the global variable and returns the API key in plain text

maml:description.maml:para: Shows the RocketCyber base URI global variable
The Get-RocketCyberBaseUri cmdlet shows the RocketCyber base URI global variable value

dev:remarks.maml:para: Shows the RocketCyber base URI global variable value

maml:description.maml:para: Gets the saved RocketCyber configuration settings
The Get-RocketCyberModuleSettings cmdlet gets the saved RocketCyber configuration settings
By default the configuration file is stored in the following location: $env:USERPROFILE\Celerium.RocketCyber
Define the location to store the RocketCyber configuration file
By default the configuration file is stored in the following location: $env:USERPROFILE\Celerium.RocketCyber
Define the name of the RocketCyber configuration file
By default the configuration file is named: config.psd1
Opens the RocketCyber configuration file
Define the location to store the RocketCyber configuration file
By default the configuration file is stored in the following location: $env:USERPROFILE\Celerium.RocketCyber
Define the name of the RocketCyber configuration file
By default the configuration file is named: config.psd1
Opens the RocketCyber configuration file

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets the contents of the configuration file that was created with the Export-RocketCyberModuleSettings
The default location of the RocketCyber configuration file is: $env:USERPROFILE\Celerium.RocketCyber\config.psd1
Opens the configuration file from the defined location in the default editor
The location of the RocketCyber configuration file in this example is: C:\Celerium.RocketCyber\MyConfig.psd1

maml:description.maml:para: Imports the RocketCyber BaseUri, API, & JSON configuration information to the current session
The Import-RocketCyberModuleSettings cmdlet imports the RocketCyber BaseUri, API, & JSON configuration information stored in the RocketCyber configuration file to the users current session
By default the configuration file is stored in the following location: $env:USERPROFILE\Celerium.RocketCyber
Define the location to store the RocketCyber configuration file
By default the configuration file is stored in the following location: $env:USERPROFILE\Celerium.RocketCyber
Define the name of the RocketCyber configuration file
By default the configuration file is named: config.psd1
Define the location to store the RocketCyber configuration file
By default the configuration file is stored in the following location: $env:USERPROFILE\Celerium.RocketCyber
Define the name of the RocketCyber configuration file
By default the configuration file is named: config.psd1

dev:remarks.maml:para: Validates that the configuration file created with the Export-RocketCyberModuleSettings cmdlet exists then imports the stored data into the current users session
The default location of the RocketCyber configuration file is: $env:USERPROFILE\Celerium.RocketCyber\config.psd1
Validates that the configuration file created with the Export-RocketCyberModuleSettings cmdlet exists then imports the stored data into the current users session
The location of the RocketCyber configuration file in this example is: C:\Celerium.RocketCyber\MyConfig.psd1

maml:description.maml:para: Makes an API request
The Invoke-RocketCyberRequest cmdlet invokes an API request to RocketCyber API
This is an internal function that is used by all public functions
As of 2023-08 the RocketCyber v1 API only supports GET requests
Defines the type of API method to use
Allowed values: 'GET'
Defines the resource uri (url) to use when creating the API call
Used with the internal function [ ConvertTo-RocketCyberQueryString ] to combine a functions parameters with the ResourceUri parameter
This allows for the full uri query to occur
The full resource path is made with the following data $RocketCyberModuleBaseURI + $ResourceUri + ConvertTo-RocketCyberQueryString
Returns all items from an endpoint
When using this parameter there is no need to use either the page or perPage parameters
Defines the type of API method to use
Allowed values: 'GET'
Defines the resource uri (url) to use when creating the API call
Used with the internal function [ ConvertTo-RocketCyberQueryString ] to combine a functions parameters with the ResourceUri parameter
This allows for the full uri query to occur
The full resource path is made with the following data $RocketCyberModuleBaseURI + $ResourceUri + ConvertTo-RocketCyberQueryString
Returns all items from an endpoint
When using this parameter there is no need to use either the page or perPage parameters

dev:remarks.maml:para: Invoke a rest method against the defined resource using any of the provided parameters
Example: Name Value ---- ----- Method GET Uri https://api-us.rocketcyber.com/v3/account?AccountId=12345&details=True Headers {Authorization = Bearer 123456789} Body

maml:description.maml:para: Removes the RocketCyber API key
The Remove-RocketCyberAPIKey cmdlet removes the RocketCyber API key
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Removes the RocketCyber API key

maml:description.maml:para: Removes the RocketCyber base URI global variable
The Remove-RocketCyberBaseUri cmdlet removes the RocketCyber base URI global variable
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Removes the RocketCyber base URI global variable

maml:description.maml:para: Removes the stored RocketCyber configuration folder
The Remove-RocketCyberModuleSettings cmdlet removes the RocketCyber folder and its files This cmdlet also has the option to remove sensitive RocketCyber variables as well
By default configuration files are stored in the following location and will be removed: $env:USERPROFILE\Celerium.RocketCyber
Define the location of the RocketCyber configuration folder
By default the configuration folder is located at: $env:USERPROFILE\Celerium.RocketCyber
Define if sensitive RocketCyber variables should be removed as well
By default the variables are not removed
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Define the location of the RocketCyber configuration folder
By default the configuration folder is located at: $env:USERPROFILE\Celerium.RocketCyber
Define if sensitive RocketCyber variables should be removed as well
By default the variables are not removed
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Checks to see if the default configuration folder exists and removes it if it does
The default location of the RocketCyber configuration folder is: $env:USERPROFILE\Celerium.RocketCyber
Checks to see if the defined configuration folder exists and removes it if it does If sensitive RocketCyber variables exist then they are removed as well
The location of the RocketCyber configuration folder in this example is: C:\Celerium.RocketCyber

maml:description.maml:para: Test the RocketCyber API key
The Test-RocketCyberAPIKey cmdlet tests the base URI & API key that was defined in the Add-RocketCyberBaseUri & Add-RocketCyberAPIKey cmdlets
Define the base URI for the RocketCyber API connection using RocketCyber's URI or a custom URI
The default base URI is https://api-us.rocketcyber.com/v3
Define the base URI for the RocketCyber API connection using RocketCyber's URI or a custom URI
The default base URI is https://api-us.rocketcyber.com/v3

dev:remarks.maml:para: Tests the base URI & API key that was defined in the Add-RocketCyberBaseUri & Add-RocketCyberAPIKey cmdlets
The default full base uri test path is: https://api-us.rocketcyber.com/v3/account/id
Tests the base URI & API key that was defined in the Add-RocketCyberBaseUri & Add-RocketCyberAPIKey cmdlets
The full base uri test path in this example is: http://myapi.gateway.celerium.org/id

The account ID to pull data for
If not provided, data will be pulled for all accounts accessible by the key

Office data will be retrieved from the AccountId 12345
Office data will be retrieved from the AccountId 12345
